+ * The future will be succeeded if the entry was successfully removed. + * Otherwise the future will be failed with a {@link org.eclipse.hono.client.ServiceInvocationException}. + * @throws NullPointerException if device id or adapter instance id is {@code null}. + */ + Future removeCommandHandlingAdapterInstance(String deviceId, String adapterInstanceId, SpanContext context); + + /** + * Gets information about the adapter instances that can handle a command for the given device. + *

+ * For a device that may communicate via a gateway, the list of all these gateways configured for the device + * has to be given in the viaGateways parameter. + *

+ * The resulting JSON object contains a list of entries associating device id and adapter instance id. This device + * id may not necessarily be the deviceId given in the method parameter, it may be the ID of one of the + * gateways acting on behalf of the device. + * Example result JSON: + * 

+     *  {
+     *   "adapter-instances": [
+     *     {
+     *       "adapter-instance-id": "adapter-1",
+     *       "device-id": "4711"
+     *     }
+     *   ]
+     * }
+     *
+ * A JSON object with a single adapter-instances entry is returned if (in order of precedence) + *
    + *
  1. an adapter instance is registered for the given device
    2. + *
  2. or there is an adapter instance registered for the last known gateway associated with the given device. + * (That gateway also has to be contained in the given list of viaGateways.)
    3. + *
+ * If both conditions are not met, all registered adapter instances for the given gateway ids (viaGateways) + * are returned in the JSON object. Example: + * 
+     *  {
+     *   "adapter-instances": [
+     *     {
+     *       "adapter-instance-id": "adapter-1",
+     *       "device-id": "gw-1"
+     *     },
+     *     {
+     *       "adapter-instance-id": "adapter-1",
+     *       "device-id": "gw-2"
+     *     }
+     *   ]
+     * }
